messages.subject: Re: Digest Number 411
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 02/10/2000 8:39:07 AM Eastern Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 02/10/2000 8:39:07 AM Eastern Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com writes:

<< I have just begun looking into unschooling and I am wondering by reading
these posts if it is more of a pagan style? I have seen a lot of things on
the wiccan way and pagan sites and I was just wondering. >>

Sandy,
I too have noticed that there are a lot of "pagan" families on this
list.... I myself am Christian. Unschooling is a style of learning where the
parent lets the child learn in a way that is best for them (very
oversimplified I know). I know many, many different types of people that
unschool that represent many different religions (or have no religion at
all). My point is that unschooling is not a religious style, it is a
learning style (however, some particular religious groups may be attracted to
unschooling).

Hugs,
Dena
